{{Infobox film | name = The Independent | image = DVD cover of the movie The Independent.jpg | image_size = | caption = DVD cover | director = [[Stephen Kessler]] | producer = [[United Lotus Group]] | writer = Stephen Kessler
[[Mike Wilkins]] | starring = [[Jerry Stiller]]
[[Janeane Garofalo]]
[[Max Perlich]]
[[Ben Stiller]] | music = [[Ben Vaughn]] | cinematography = [[Amir Hamed]] | editing = [[Chris Franklin]] | distributor = [[Arrow Entertainment]] | released = {{Film date|2000|11|30}} | runtime = 80 mins | country = United States | language = [[English language|English]] | gross = $238,431{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt0160403/?ref_=bo_se_r_1|title=The Independent|website=[[Box Office Mojo]]|accessdate=January 14, 2020}} }} '''''The Independent''''' is a [[mockumentary]] comedy film made in 2000, directed by [[Stephen Kessler]] and starring [[Jerry Stiller]] and [[Janeane Garofalo]]. Stiller portrays an independent film maker who makes little-known [[B movies]] with titles like ''Twelve Angry Men and a Baby''. The film [[Parody|spoofs]] independent directors and [[independent films|independent film]]. The film features [[Max Perlich]] and cameos by [[Anne Meara]], [[Ron Howard]], [[Roger Corman]], [[Peter Bogdanovich]], [[John Lydon]], [[Ben Stiller]], [[Andy Dick]], [[Fred Dryer]], [[Jonathan Katz]], [[Fred Williamson]], [[Karen Black]], [[Nick Cassavetes]], [[Julie Strain]] and adult film actress [[Ginger Lynn]]. The fictional career of Morty Fineman (Stiller) includes having made 427 films, although it is not specified as to whether he directed them all or if it refers to films produced or written by the Fineman character. The theme song ''The Love Song For 'The Independent''' is performed by [[Nancy Sinatra]]. == Reception == On [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds an approval rating of 60% based on 48 reviews.{{cite web|url=https://rottentomatoes.com/m/the_independent|title=The Independent (2001)|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media|Fandango]]|accessdate=January 14, 2020}} On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalized rating to reviews, the film has a weighted average score of 52 out of 100, based on 17 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/movie/the-independent|title=The Independent Reviews|website=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=January 14, 2020}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title|id=0160403|title=The Independent}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Independent, The}} [[Category:2000 films]] [[Category:2000 comedy films]] [[Category:American mockumentary films]] [[Category:American independent films]] [[Category:Films set in California]] [[Category:Films about filmmaking]] [[Category:American comedy films]] [[Category:American films]]
